As for Bungo swords, the very nice naginata that came through that 
really =
got me pretty hot was signed Iesada and as assigned to a Bungo 
smith. It s=
cored 81 points.

Gordon

On =C3=A3=E2=80=A1=C3=B3j=C3=AC=CB=99, 9 24, 2004=
, at 03:56  AM, Jim Gilbert wrote:

> Milt,
> Yes, Shoami can be great.=C2=
=A0 As with Bungo Takada there are both very 
> good ones and poor ones.=C2=
=A0 I personally like good Ko-Shoami work a > lot.=C2=A0
>
> You're talking=
 about the Yagyu guard with the dice game motif that 
> went through while =
you were working the first day?=C2=A0 The quality of the 
> iron and the wo=
rk in the rim are the most important kantei points, so 
> don't forget what=
 you saw.=C2=A0 That shape is a distinctive Yagyu trait -- 
> curved sides,=
 almost straight top and bottom, sometimes with a "bump" 
> in the middle.=
=C2=A0 Of course there are also plenty of round ones.=C2=A0 The 
> design o=
f dice and gaming chips is very unusual for Yagyu (or anyone 
> else).=C2=
=A0 I'm not sure what to make of it, made for a gambler?
>
> Yes there is a=
 Yagyu design book.=C2=A0 I have a photocopy of a hand-drawn 
> copy, which=
 was copied from another hand drawn copy.=C2=A0 This design is 
> not in it=
, but I've seen other Yagyu designs that do not appear in the 
> book.=C2=
=A0 It's an interesting document, but not the final word on Yagyu 
> (at le=
ast the copy I have, there may be other variations).=C2=A0 Yagyu is a 
> ve=
ry complicated topic.
>
> Jim
>
>
>
> =C2=A0 thanks, Jim et al,
>
> =C2=A0 =
All kidding aside, there is nothing wrong with Shoami, right ?
> =C2=A0 Sor=
t of like " Bungo Takada swords " of tsuba world ?
>
> =C2=A0 Question rega=
rding the yagyu guard.............
> =C2=A0 Besides the quality of the iron=
 + the " masame like bones ? " on the
> =C2=A0 mimi, why Yagyu ?=C2=A0
> =
=C2=A0 To my untrained eyes, the design looks Shoami or certainly not the
>=
 =C2=A0 usual waves based design that's typical of that school.
> =C2=A0 Is=
 that particular design listed in the Yagyu design book ?=C2=A0 An old
> =
=C2=A0 timer told me there's such a book.=C2=A0 True ?
>
> =C2=A0 Again, th=
anks, it was fun making copies........just like that
> =C2=A0 character in =
Saturday Live.
